backend.storage.file

Class CaseFile

  • java.lang.Object
    • backend.storage.file.CaseFile
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BackupFile, LiveFile

    public class CaseFile
extends java.lang.Object
    Class used to represent a case evidence file read in from one of the managed local directories.
    Since:
    0.1
    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    Jacob Jones, Andrew Rottier

    • Constructor Detail

      • CaseFile

        public CaseFile(Case parentCase,
        java.lang.String filePath)
         throws InvalidFileException
        Initializes and populates instance fields.
        Parameters:
        parentCase - the instance of Case that this file is attached to
        filePath - String value containing the full file path associated with this file
        Throws:
        InvalidFileException - if there is an error in reading this file into memory
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any parameters are null

      • retrieveFileExt

        private java.lang.String retrieveFileExt()
                                  throws InvalidFileException
        Determines the extension of this file.
        Returns:
        the file extension, including the preceding period, pulled from the full path
        Throws:
        InvalidFileException - if the file does not have an extension

      • retrieveFileType

        private java.lang.String retrieveFileType()
                                   throws InvalidFileException
        Determines the type of this file.
        Returns:
        the file type pulled from the file extension
        Throws:
        InvalidFileException - if the file type can not be determined, or the file is not a valid image (png or jpeg)

      • retrieveFileIndex

        private int retrieveFileIndex()
                       throws InvalidFileException
        Determines the index of this file within its parent case.
        Returns:
        the file index pulled from the file name
        Throws:
        InvalidFileException - if the name of the file is not properly formatted for use by PEMS
